title: Turkey Boosts Reserve Rules on Some Deposits to Support Lira
content: Turkey raised the amount of cash lenders must park with the central bank against some deposits, as part of measures to support the lira after it became the worst-performer in the Europe, Middle East and Africa region.

title: India to See Limited Inflation Fallout From Oil, Government Adviser Says
content: India’s top government adviser said rising oil prices are likely to have a limited impact on inflation for now and Asia’s third-largest economy remains in a relatively favorable position to weather global risks.

title: Ex-Columbia Grad Student Khalil Released From ICE Custody
content: A former Columbia University graduate student detained for more than three months over his role in pro-Palestinian protests was released Friday from immigration detention, allowing him to continue a legal fight to avoid deportation while out on bail.

title: Summers on the Fed, Aramco Evolution, Future of AI, Themed Entertainment Industry | Wall Street Week
content: This week, Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers on the recent Fed decision and the economic implications of uncertainty in the Middle East. And, how is Saudi giant Aramco diversifying in a tech-driven world? Plus, an interview with Robinhood’s Vlad Tenev on artificial intelligence solutions for nuanced needs. Later, Netflix is entering the themed entertainment business with Netflix House, further intensifying its competition with traditional media players. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: S&P 500 Trading Volume Spikes at Wall Street Close | The Close 6/20/2025
content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Anthony Saglimbene, Ameriprise Financial, Chris O’Cull, Stifel Financial, Jacob DeWitte, Oklo, Ray Takeyh, Council on Foreign Relations, Cole Smead, Smead Capital Management, Que Nguyen, Research Affiliates, Sonali Theisen, Bank of America, Joe Mathieu, Bloomberg News, Kim Wallace, 22V Research, Ice Cube, Big3, Jennifer Openshaw, Girls With Impact. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Shock-Proof Oil Stocks to Weather the Geopolitical Storm
content: Cole Smead, Smead Capital Management, CEO & Portfolio Manager speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about navigating the volatile oil market. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Obstructions Remain in Potential US-Iran Talks: Expert
content: Ray Takeyh, Senior Fellow at The Council on Foreign Relations speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about the Israel and Iran conflict and the role the US will play. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oklo CEO on What's Driven the Stock Up +500% in a Year
content: Jacob DeWitte, Oklo CEO & Co-Founder speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about the success of Oklo this past year and what the future holds. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ardian's Mark Benedetti on Democratizing PE (Correct)
content: Ardian Executive President Mark Benedetti discuses the democratization of private equity on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Corrects spelling of guest's name in headline) (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Musk’s xAI Lures Investors to Sweetened $5 Billion Debt Deal
content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI Corp. lured enough investors to its $5 billion debt deal by offering sweeter pricing on Friday.

title: How Ice Cube's Big3 Is Changing the Game
content: Music Legend, Actor and Producer Ice Cube discusses how Big3, the 3-on-3 basketball league he founded, is changing the game with Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Abolishing FEMA’ Memo Outlines Ways for Trump to Scrap Agency
content:
A memo titled "Abolishing FEMA" outlines ways for Trump to scrap the agency. 

 Zahra Hirji explains how the administration aims to create a re-branded, radically smaller disaster response organization. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: CarMax Earnings Show Rise in Used Car Demand | Bloomberg Markets 6/20/2025
content: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Bloomberg's Nir Kaissar, David Welch, Michelle Cortez, and Rachel Phua. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Refining Capacity Declines Amid Uncertain Fuel Demand Outlook
content: US refiners’ operating capacity edged lower in 2024 as an uncertain outlook for gasoline and diesel prompted fuelmakers to pull back after a period of expansion.

title: S&P 500 Trading Volume Spikes at Wall Street Close: Markets Wrap
content: A jittery week ended with losses in stocks as investors weighed geopolitical and trade developments, chipmakers sank while a $6.5 trillion options expiration spurred a surge in volume. Short-dated yields fell as Federal Reserve’s Christopher Waller said rates could drop as early as July.

title: Hedge Funds Rush Into Oil Long Bets as Mideast Conflict Grows
content: Hedge funds boosted their bullish position in Brent crude by the most since early October as Israel’s strikes against Iran’s nuclear program imperiled a region that produces around a third of the world’s oil.

title: Trump Says Iran Wants to Speak With US, Not Europe
content: President Donald Trump says two weeks is the maximum amount of time he will allow to pursue diplomacy with Iran while speaking with reporters. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Equities Finish Choppy Session Lower | Closing Bell
content: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Wall Street’s First-Half Whiplash Rewards All-Weather Portfolios
content: Somehow, for all its drama — tariffs, fiscal brinkmanship, inflation fears, and geopolitical flare-ups — the first half of 2025 may be remembered by diversified investors for something else entirely: the strongest stretch of synchronized market gains in years.

title: Fed’s Daly Says Next Rate Cut More Likely in the Fall
content: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said an interest-rate cut this fall looks more appropriate than moving when policymakers gather in July.

title: Bitcoin Network Activity Slows While Price Lingers Near Highs
content: Once institutional investors are finally onboard has long been a rallying cry for Bitcoin enthusiasts projecting sky-high price forecasts.

title: US Stocks Extend Losing Run as Geopolitics Dampens Investor Mood
content: US stocks ended the week with losses as investors assessed the latest geopolitical developments and tried to determine the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate path.

title: Circle Gets Buy Rating After Senate Passes Stablecoin Bill
content: Circle Internet Group Inc.’s shares jumped 20% on Friday after Seaport Global gave the stablecoin issuer its first buy rating in the wake of the US Senate’s move this week to pass legislation setting up regulatory rules for cryptocurrencies pegged to the dollar.

title: Oil Drops as Trump Eases Concerns About Imminent Strike on Iran
content: Oil fell after President Donald Trump signaled a decision on whether to strike Iran will be made within two weeks, easing concerns about an imminent attack from the US.

title: LME Sets New Rule Forcing Traders to Reduce Big Metals Bets
content: The London Metal Exchange has imposed a new rule to force traders to reduce large positions, after the market was rocked in recent months by the arrival of some of the world’s biggest energy traders.

title: AQR’s Cliff Asness Sides With Jim Chanos in Critique of Michael Saylor’s Strategy
content: AQR Capital Management’s Cliff Asness says he’s in agreement with famed short seller Jim Chanos when it comes to his criticism of Strategy founder Michael Saylor’s claim that the use of convertible debt affords the leveraged Bitcoin proxy downside protection while continuing to accumulate the cryptocurrency.

title: Government Contractors Recruit Fewer Prospects
content: Thousands of private government consultants laid off during the Trump administration’s cost-cutting crusade are increasingly flooding a shrinking labor market. Bloomberg's Rachel Phua has more on the story.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: September Is Live Meeting for Fed, Says Guggenheim's Brown
content: Guggenheim Fixed Income CIO Steven Brown says September will be a "live meeting" for the Federal Reserve when it decides on interest rates. He speaks on "Bloomberg Real Yield." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Fed's Next Move, Narrowing Labor Market, Inflation
content: Guggenheim’s Fixed Income CIO Steven Brown and Columbia Threadneedle’s Global Rates Strategist Ed Al-Hussainy discussed what and when will be Fed's next move. They flagged a slowing job market and narrowing labor cushion, warning that even slight rises in unemployment could shift the Fed’s tone — especially as more inflation and tariff data come in. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Robot Delivery Service Plans US and Europe Expansion
content: Coco Robotics, the maker of cooler-sized delivery robots, has raised $80 million in its latest funding round to improve the technology and expand to new cities. CEO Zach Rash discusses how the service has been performing in L.A., Helsinki, and other cities with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Israel-Iran War Reaches Second Week as Trump Sends Mixed Signals
content: Israel and Iran launched new strikes in a second week of hostilities, as Donald Trump deepened uncertainty about his readiness to join the conflict and dismissed European efforts to find a diplomatic solution.

title: Starmer Faces Brewing Rebellion Over £5 Billion Benefit Cut
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is less than 10 days away from the biggest parliamentary challenge to his authority in his not-yet year-long tenure.

title: China’s Top HK Official Says Security Will Ensure City’s Success
content: China’s top official for Hong Kong affairs said the city needs to prioritize national security to ensure prosperity.

title: Judge Says He Will Order Ex-Columbia Student Khalil Freed From Detention
content: JENA, La. (AP) — Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil was released Friday from federal immigration detention, freed after 104 days by a judge’s ruling after becoming a symbol of President Donald Trump ’s clampdown on campus protests.

title: India to See Limited Inflation Fallout From Oil, Government Adviser Says
content: India’s top government adviser said rising oil prices are likely to have a limited impact on inflation for now and Asia’s third-largest economy remains in a relatively favorable position to weather global risks.

title: Dr. Phil’s Media Company Cuts 40 More Jobs, Pauses Evening News
content: Merit Street Media, the company founded by celebrity psychologist Phil McGraw, has cut jobs and paused some programming, according to a spokesperson.

title: Universities Win Order Voiding Agency’s 15% Research Cost Cap
content: Brown and Cornell universities, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and several other US schools won a federal court order striking down a National Science Foundation cap on indirect cost rates for government-funded research.

title: China, Philippines Report Encounter in South China Sea
content: China’s coast guard said it drove away a Philippine ship around Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea, the latest friction in a longstanding rivalry in the strategic waterway.

title: Carney Bill to Speed Projects Passes Vote Despite Indigenous Opposition
content: Canada’s House of Commons cleared a bill to accelerate the building of major projects such as pipelines, but Indigenous groups are threatening to force a legal battle over it.

title: Deal, Not Bombs, Seen as Only Way to End Iranian Nuclear Threat
content: While President Donald Trump weighs whether to join Israel’s assault on Iran, foreign policy veterans and analysts argue that a negotiated settlement, not bombs nor commandos, is the only way to eliminate the threat of Tehran gaining a nuclear weapon.

title: Harvard Nears ‘Mindbogglingly’ Historic US Deal, Trump Says
content: President Donald Trump said his administration has been holding talks with Harvard University and may announce a deal over the next week, potentially ending a standoff that has jeopardized billions of dollars of the school’s funding and ignited a rollicking legal fight.

title: Trump Says Spain Has to Pay as NATO Seeks Deal on Spending
content: NATO allies are pressing Spain to sign on to a stepped-up defense spending target and end a holdout that US President Donald Trump portrayed as unacceptable.

title: Trump Sends Mixed Signals on Iran Strikes With Ceasefire Hint
content: Donald Trump deepened uncertainty about his readiness to join Israel’s week-old war with Iran, signaling he might consider backing a ceasefire but also warning that he could order military action sooner than the deadline he flagged just a day earlier.

title: Trump Keeps the World Waiting With Deadlines and Deferrals
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: America the Avoidable: Why Trump’s Policies Could Cost US Tourism Billions
content: On today’s Big Take podcast: How President Trump’s “American First” policies have kept international tourists away, forecasted to cost the US travel industry billions.

title: Harvard Gets Longer Reprieve From Trump Foreign Student Ban
content: A federal judge issued a new order that allows Harvard University to continue enrolling foreign students while the school fights the Trump administration’s efforts to prevent it from doing so.

title: EU Finds Israel May Have Broken Human Rights Terms in Accord
content: A report commissioned by the European Union found that Israel may have broken the humanitarian terms of the accord that dictates their bilateral relations.

title: Under New Leadership, OAS Is Determined to Show Progress on Haiti
content: Amid pressure from Washington to resolve the crisis in Haiti, the new head of the Western Hemisphere’s top multilateral organization pledged to work with the United Nations and international donors to chart a roadmap for peace in the violence-torn island nation.

title: NYC Sets Smaller Driver Pay Bump After Uber, Lyft Pushback
content: New York City on Friday announced new minimum-pay rules for rideshare drivers, settling on a smaller-than-proposed 5% increase following pushback from Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc.

title: Niger Junta Seizes French Nuclear Giant Orano’s Uranium Mine
content: Niger’s military government took control of Orano SA’s uranium mine, escalating a standoff with the French nuclear-power company.

title: Trump Allowed to Keep Using National Guard in LA for Now
content: President Donald Trump can continue to use California National Guard troops to respond to protests in Los Angeles as a legal challenge over the deployment proceeds, a federal appeals court ruled.

title: No Urgent Need for Key Producers to Aid Oil Market, Putin Says
content: The global oil market so far does not call for any additional steps from producers amid the conflict between Israel and Iran as the tensions have had only a limited effect on prices, according to Russia’s President Vladimir Putin.

title: Why a Remote UK Base Makes the US-Iran Standoff So Difficult for Starmer
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will be relieved by US President Donald Trump’s move to delay a decision for now on striking Iran, giving the British leader more time to address the vexing issue of providing military support.

title: US Sanctions Target Iran Defense Industry, Houthis
content: The US escalated pressure on Iran with sanctions targeting individuals and companies allegedly involved in obtaining machinery for its defense industry, as well as those backing a militant group with ties to the regime.

title: Russia Says Israel, US Pledge Staff Safety at Iran Nuclear Plant
content: President Vladimir Putin said Russia sought and received assurances from Israel and the US that they’d ensure the safety of Russian staff working at Iran’s nuclear power plant at Bushehr.

title: Supreme Court Refuses to Expedite Challenge to Trump’s Tariffs
content: The US Supreme Court refused to put a challenge to President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs on an ultra-fast track.

title: Putin Says He Isn’t Seeking Ukraine’s ‘Capitulation’ to End War
content: President Vladimir Putin said he isn’t seeking Ukraine’s “capitulation” as a way to end the war, even as he reiterated his claim that the two countries are one people.

title: NYC's Zohran Mamdani Tries Selling Socialism to the Home of Wall Street
content: For the full experience visit: NYC's Zohran Mamdani Tries Selling Socialism to the Home of Wall Street

title: Spain’s Indra Downplays Franco-German Sparring Over Fighter Jet
content: Indra Sistemas SA’s chairman sought to assuage doubts over Europe’s next-generation fighter-jet program, after disagreements between partners Dassault Aviation SA and Airbus SE broke into the open this week.

title: UN Chief Calls for Diplomacy as Israel-Iran War Rages
content: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called for a return to negotiations to resolve the conflict between Israel and Iran, warning that the world is “on course to potential chaos” if it expands.

title: Bezos Wedding Draws Protests, Soul-Searching Over Tourism in Venice
content: The $10 million bash has called attention to whether the city needs to take stronger actions to stop a deluge of visitors.

title: Can Europe Win the AI Race?
content: Silicon Valley dominates artificial intelligence headlines, but a quiet AI revolution is unfolding across Europe -- from billion-dollar startups to a growing push for sovereignty in the tech of tomorrow. Bloomberg's Tom Mackenzie explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Continental’s Split Shows How Germany’s Business Model Is Shifting
content: Continental AG intends to become the latest German manufacturing stalwart to dismantle itself, highlighting the pressure to become more agile to weather structural issues at home and respond to mounting competition abroad.

content: Mitsubishi Corp. will invest $3.9 billion to boost solar power generation in the US through its unit, the Nikkei newspaper reported.

title: Toyota to Raise US Auto Prices by More Than $200 From July
content: Toyota Motor Corp. will raise prices of some vehicles it sells in the US by more than $200 starting next month.

title: Singapore Members Club 1880’s Staff In Bid to Revive Firm: BT
content: The staff of Singapore private members club 1880 have made an offer to buy the club’s assets with the backing of its landlord RB Corp., a member of RB Capital Group, according to The Business Times.

On today's show, Kenneth Pollack, Vice President for Policy at the Middle East Institute, discusses President Trump's two week delay on deciding whether or not the US will strike Iran. PWC National Tax Office Co-Leader Rohit Kumar shares his thoughts on the latest with the Tax Bill & the US Senate. Rebecca Shi, American Business Immigration Coalition Executive Director, discusses the impact ICE raids are having on the US labor force. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Tech Summit
content: Leaders from across tech and business discuss how to navigate today's hazards and create opportunities. Guests include Google's Sundar Pichai, Meta's Andrew Bosworth, Uber's Dara Khosrowshahi, and Agility Robotics's Peggy Johnson. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Novo’s Latest Obesity Drug Shows 24% Weight Loss in Small Trial
content: Novo Nordisk A/S’s latest experimental obesity drug helped patients lose as much as 24.3% of their weight in a small study, showing its potential as a next-generation treatment in the hyper-competitive market.

She speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Kenneth Pollack, Vice President for Policy at the Middle East Institute, discusses President Trump's two week delay on deciding whether or not the US will strike Iran, and what factors must be considered. title: Andreessen Horowitz Backs AI Startup With Slogan ‘Cheat at Everything’
content: Andreessen Horowitz led a $15 million funding round for an artificial intelligence startup called Cluely Inc., famous on social platforms like X for controversial viral marketing stunts and the slogan “cheat on everything.”

title: Apple Executives Have Held Internal Talks About Buying AI Startup Perplexity
content: Apple Inc. executives have held internal discussions about potentially bidding for artificial intelligence startup Perplexity AI, seeking to address the need for more AI talent and technology.

title: Circle Gets Buy Rating After Senate Passes Stablecoin Bill
content: Circle Internet Group Inc.’s shares jumped 20% on Friday after Seaport Global gave the stablecoin issuer its first buy rating in the wake of the US Senate’s move this week to pass legislation setting up regulatory rules for cryptocurrencies pegged to the dollar.

title: SoftBank’s Son Pitches $1 Trillion US AI Hub | Bloomberg Tech 6/20/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son’s pitch to build a trillion-dollar AI industrial complex with TSMC in Arizona. Plus, the global robotaxi market heats up as Baidu looks to expand internationally and Tesla prepares to launch its service in Austin. And Meta rolls out new smart-glasses in a partnership with Oakley.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: NYC Sets Smaller Driver Pay Bump After Uber, Lyft Pushback
content: New York City on Friday announced new minimum-pay rules for rideshare drivers, settling on a smaller-than-proposed 5% increase following pushback from Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc.

title: LinkedIn’s CEO Has Advice to Help AI-Proof Your Career
content: LinkedIn’s CEO offers his thoughts on how AI is changing the way people work, himself included. But first…

title: Meta Discussed Buying Perplexity Before Investing in Scale
content: Meta Platforms Inc. held discussions with artificial intelligence search startup Perplexity AI Inc. about a possible takeover before moving ahead with a multibillion-dollar investment in Scale AI, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Meta Launches $399 Oakley AI Glasses With 3K Video Recording
content: Meta Platforms Inc. is going up-market with its surprise hit smart glasses, rolling out new models with Oakley that are aimed at athletes and include improved video recording.

title: Aflac Reports Potential Leak of Personal Data in Breach
content: Aflac Inc. said a recent cybersecurity breach could have given intruders unauthorized access to customers’ personal information, including Social Security numbers, as well as health and claims data.

title: Israel Says Iran Is Hacking Private Security Cameras
content: Iran is tapping into private security cameras in Israel to gather real-time intelligence about its adversary, exposing a recurrent problem with the devices that has emerged in other global conflicts. Bloomberg's Michael Shepard reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Dark Web Forum Tried to Hide by Shifting to Privacy-Focused Crypto
Startup Too Good To Go Weighs €300 Million Funding Round
content: Too Good To Go, which operates an app that allows users to buy near-expired food at a discount, is considering raising €200 million ($231 million) to €300 million in a new funding round to support its business expansion, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Amazon Ends Speedy Delivery by Kia Soul in Favor of Gig Workers
content: Amazon.com Inc. is ending an experiment that saw drivers in Kia Souls make same-day deliveries and will rely on its network of gig-economy workers instead.

title: How Telegram Became a Magnet for Extremists, Crime
content: Messaging service Telegram is one of the most downloaded apps worldwide. Its private chat setting has made it a free space for open discussion in countries with authoritarian regimes. But a relatively light-touch approach to content moderation on Telegram is frustrating governments trying to stop criminal activities and the spread of misinformation that can destabilize societies.

title: Chip Stocks Slide on Report of New Possible Limits on China
content: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and other chipmakers slid on Friday after the Wall Street Journal reported that the Trump administration is considering further restrictions on China.

title: Trump Pledge of Quick China Magnet Flows Has Yet to Materialize
content: Almost 10 days since President Donald Trump declared a “done” trade deal with Beijing, US companies remain largely in the dark on when they’ll receive crucial magnets from China — and whether Washington, in turn, will allow a host of other exports to resume.

title: German Startup Neura Robotics Eyes Up to €1 Billion Round
content: German startup Neura Robotics is targeting to raise as much as €1 billion ($1.2 billion) in new funding as the company prepares to debut a humanoid robot, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trust in AI Strongest in China, Low-Income Nations, Study Shows
content: A United Nations study found a sharp global divide on attitudes toward artificial intelligence, with trust strongest in low-income countries and skepticism high in wealthier ones.

title: Tencent Music Shares Double on Break From China Price Cut Script
content: China tech investors weary of the nation’s relentless price competition can look to one pocket that’s thriving by moving in the opposite direction: online music.

title: One in Four Indians Uses Only a Mobile for Content, Ditching TV
content: Nearly one in four Indians said in a survey they use only mobile phones to consume media content, as TVs stay unaffordable for many, prompting companies from Meta Platforms Inc. to Netflix Inc. to boost digital strategies in the world’s largest consumer market.

title: Nidec CEO Stresses Compliance in Shift From Fixation on Growth
content: Nidec Corp. founder Shigenobu Nagamori said the Japanese maker of precision motors is prioritizing compliance, stepping away from a half-century-long focus on profit and growth.

title: ICG Targets €10 Billion for Flagship Flexible Capital Fund
content: Intermediate Capital Group Plc. is looking to raise €10 billion ($11.5 billion) for its flagship flexible capital strategy, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: HBO’s ‘Mountainhead’ Depicts Hollywood’s Sinister View of Tech Titans
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet looks at how HBO’s movie Mountainhead shows the changing cultural view of tech’s rich and powerful.

title: Masa Son Pitches $1 Trillion US AI Hub to TSMC, Trump Team
content: SoftBank Group Corp. founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to team up with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. to realize what could be his biggest bet yet — a trillion-dollar industrial complex in Arizona to build robots and artificial intelligence.

title: Pignataro’s ION Plans to Invest in Azimut-Backed Fintech
content: Andrea Pignataro’s ION Group plans to buy a minority stake in a new Italian digital bank backed by private equity firm FSI SGR SpA and asset manager Azimut Holding SpA, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: California Utilities Expand Power Shutdowns as Winds Rise
content: California utilities cut power to more than 62,000 customers across the state in an attempt to stop wildfires from starting as dry winds sweep the region.

title: Japan Chemicals Firm CEO Fights to Keep Job as Investors Revolt
content: In a sign of rising shareholders’ activism, a president of a semiconductor material maker is at risk of getting voted out of office at the firm’s annual general meeting Saturday.

title: Globe Says Supply Chain Risks ‘Mitigated’ Amid US-China Tensions
content: Philippine mobile leader Globe Telecom Inc. has mitigated supply chain risks with diversified Chinese and Western vendors, its chief executive officer said, as companies navigate US-China tensions.

title: Israeli Officials Warn Iran Is Hijacking Security Cameras to Spy
content: Iran is tapping into private security cameras in Israel to gather real-time intelligence about its adversary, exposing a recurrent problem with the devices that has emerged in other global conflicts.

title: Uber Warns Hong Kong Drivers, Riders of Possible New Curbs
content: Uber Technologies Inc. is emailing Hong Kong users to raise concerns about rules the city is formulating, warning the government could cap the number of drivers or vehicles allowed on the platform.

title: Surging UK Grocery Bills Threaten to Rekindle Inflation Fears
content: Surging grocery bills are threatening to slow the pace of the Bank of England’s interest-rate cuts by raising the risk that inflation will stay elevated even as the UK economy shows signs of sputtering.

title: India to See Limited Inflation Fallout From Oil, Government Adviser Says
content: India’s top government adviser said rising oil prices are likely to have a limited impact on inflation for now and Asia’s third-largest economy remains in a relatively favorable position to weather global risks.

title: Waller Says Fed Could Cut Interest Rates as Soon as July
content: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said the central bank can lower interest rates as soon as next month, reiterating his view that the inflation hit from tariffs is likely to be short-lived.

title: Fed’s Daly Says Next Rate Cut More Likely in the Fall
content: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said an interest-rate cut this fall looks more appropriate than moving when policymakers gather in July.

title: Employees Terrified of ICE Raids Are Failing to Show Up at Work
content: High-profile immigration raids are scaring off workers and leaving employers unsure of how they’ll manage without them.

title: America the Avoidable: Why Trump’s Policies Could Cost US Tourism Billions
content: On today’s Big Take podcast: How President Trump’s “American First” policies have kept international tourists away, forecasted to cost the US travel industry billions.

title: Fed’s Musalem Reports Multiple Real Estate Transactions
content: A new set of financial disclosures for Federal Reserve regional bank heads released Friday show that St. Louis Fed President Alberto Musalem and his spouse sold and purchased several residential real estate holdings last year.

title: The Two New Tensions at the Federal Reserve
content: Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.

title: The US Has More Copper Than China But No Way to Refine All of It
content: The industry will need to overcome high energy and labor costs, environmental regulations and a glut of cheap Chinese competition to make US copper smelting great again.

title: Trump Pledge of Quick China Magnet Flows Has Yet to Materialize
content: Almost 10 days since President Donald Trump declared a “done” trade deal with Beijing, US companies remain largely in the dark on when they’ll receive crucial magnets from China — and whether Washington, in turn, will allow a host of other exports to resume.

title: Fed Says Labor Market Balanced, Points to Immigration Slowdown
content: A sharp stepdown in immigration has led the supply of workers to grow more slowly, helping to keep the labor market in balance as job growth cools, the Federal Reserve said Friday.

title: Canada Retail Sales Fell 1.1% in May, Largest Drop in a Year
content: The strain on Canadian consumers became more evident last month after a rush to buy cars ahead of price increases from tariffs appeared to come to an end.

title: Thousands of Laid-Off Government Workers Are Flooding a Shrinking Job Market
content: Thousands of private government consultants laid off during the Trump administration’s cost-cutting crusade are increasingly flooding a shrinking labor market.

title: RBI Front-Loaded Rate Action to Spur Demand, Minutes Show
content: India’s rate-setters opted for a larger-than-expected interest rate cut to spur demand, while adjusting the policy stance to retain flexibility amid global uncertainty, minutes of the central bank’s policy meeting showed Friday.

title: Banks Offer Higher Rates on Deposits as BOE Drains Liquidity
content: UK banks are offering unusually high interest rates to clients in order to attract cash, the latest sign of how the Bank of England’s balance-sheet reduction is shrinking liquidity in the system.

title: Plunging UK Retail Sales Deepen Concern About Broader Slowdown
content: A dramatic drop in UK retail sales is raising fresh questions about the sustainability of Britain’s recent growth spurt and Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s plans to use it to restore controversial benefit cuts.

title: Thriving Southern Cities Face Economic Threat From Funding Cuts
content: North Carolina's Research Triangle shows how federal efforts to curb spending are unleashing economic uncertainty in communities across the US.

title: China Shrugs Off Tariffs But Not its Property Slump
content: I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. Today we’re looking at China’s property drag. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Japan Surprises With Bigger Cut to Super-Long Bond Issuance
content: Japan is planning to cut the issuance of super-long bonds this year by more than earlier reported as it tries to restore calm to a market spooked by recent record highs in yields.

title: Political Woes Could Sink Thai Economy Deeper Into Malaise
content: Thailand’s sudden descent into a new political crisis threatens an economy that’s already on the brink of a technical recession and bracing for the impact of the global trade war.

title: BOE’s Bailey Raises Doubts Over Digital Pound for Consumers
content: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey cast doubt on the need for a digital pound for consumers, calling into question whether the UK will push ahead with its plans.

title: A Guide to Trade Talks, Trump-Style: Is His Unorthodox Approach Working?
content: The president is trying force rather than persuasion to secure improved access to foreign markets for US companies. The quick wins he promised are yet to materialize.

title: Zichen Wang's Exit Interview From America
content: The popular Substacker returns home to China.

title: Odd Lots: Zichen Wang’s Exit Interview from America (Podcast)
content: Zichen Wang is the writer of the Pekingnology newsletter, which translates important speeches and articles from China into English, and contextualizes them for Western readers. Over the past year, he’s been a master’s degree student at Princeton University, although he’s recently returned home to resume his career at a think tank in China. His stint in the US obviously came at a very interesting time, both due to the rising US-China tensions, and also the growing restrictions on Chinese students

title: Japan’s Prices Climb by Most in Two Years Ahead of Election
content: Japan’s key consumer inflation measure accelerated more than expected to a fresh two-year high, as Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba gears up for a summer election and the Bank of Japan mulls the country’s price trajectory.

title: Japan Won’t Fixate on July 9 in US Trade Talks, Akazawa Says
content: Japan won’t fixate on the looming date for so-called reciprocal tariffs to go back to higher levels, Tokyo’s top trade negotiator said, signaling that the Asian nation stands ready for the possibility that talks will drag on.

title: French Manufacturing Confidence Unexpectedly Dips in June
content: French manufacturing confidence fell unexpectedly in June, adding to warning signs for an economy already struggling to keep pace with European peers.

title: UK Budget Deficit Running Below Forecast in Boost for Reeves
content: UK government borrowing came in below forecast in the first two months of the fiscal year, a modest boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves as she faces growing questions over whether she can keep to her budget limits without further tax and spending pain.

title: US Tariff Spike Hits China’s Small Parcels, Squeezing Exporters
content: US tariff hikes on small packages from China triggered a slump in shipments last month, contributing to a huge drop in bilateral trade and roiling exporters like Shein Group Ltd.

title: Fidelity Fund Bets on Midcaps Saying Tariff Shock Is Over
content: Financial markets have seen the worst of Donald Trump’s tariff threats, helping make midcap stocks an attractive buy as the outlook improves, according to a Fidelity International money manager.

title: Trump Administration’s New Rule Will Limit Obamacare Enrollments
content: Trump administration officials on Friday finalized regulations aimed at making it more difficult to enroll in health insurance through the Affordable Care Act.

title: Hedge Funds Rush Into Oil Long Bets as Mideast Conflict Grows
content: Hedge funds boosted their bullish position in Brent crude by the most since early October as Israel’s strikes against Iran’s nuclear program imperiled a region that produces around a third of the world’s oil.

title: America the Avoidable: Why Trump’s Policies Could Cost US Tourism Billions
content: On today’s Big Take podcast: How President Trump’s “American First” policies have kept international tourists away, forecasted to cost the US travel industry billions.

title: Third Point, Arb Funds Reap Big Gains as US Steel Bet Pays Out
content: US hedge funds including Third Point LLC and Pentwater Capital Management are reaping a windfall from bets that political noise wouldn’t keep United States Steel Corp. from completing its $14.1 billion deal with its Japanese suitor.

title: How Long Before We Get a $6 Trillion Sports Team?
content: The LA Lakers being acquired for $10 billion smashes the record for a pro franchise.

title: CareerBuilder and Monster Venture Said to Consider Bankruptcy
content: A joint venture involving CareerBuilder and Monster, the early pioneers of online job hunting, is working with advisers on a potential bankruptcy filing, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Alberta Pension Looks For New CIO Amid Push to Expand Calgary Office
content: Alberta Investment Management Corp. is hunting for a new chief investment officer as it carries out an overhaul that began last year when the provincial government fired the board and its top executive.

title: Kroger Sales Beat Expectations on Steady Grocery Spending
content: Kroger Co.’s sales surpassed expectations during the latest quarter, a sign that consumers are still spending on groceries and other essentials despite economic turbulence.

title: Mark Walter Is Creating a Sports Empire With $10 Billion Lakers
content: For just under $10 billion, private equity firm 3G Capital recently bought Skechers — an ascendant global footwear brand with $9 billion in annual sales and 20,000 employees spread across 5,300 stores.

title: Not All Ritalin Is Created Equal: Why Some Generics Fail to Work
content: Stanford University researchers have discovered why some people with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder may do well on their medicine for a while but struggle down the road.

title: Weight-Loss Drugs Should Be First Step to Prevent Heart Disease, Top Cardiology Group Says
content: Millions more Americans should be taking weight-loss drugs to prevent heart disease, according to the American College of Cardiology.

title: The US Has More Copper Than China But No Way to Refine All of It
content: The industry will need to overcome high energy and labor costs, environmental regulations and a glut of cheap Chinese competition to make US copper smelting great again.

title: QXO Won’t Raise Its Offer for GMS After Report of Home Depot Bid
content: QXO Inc. won’t raise its $5 billion offer for building products distributor GMS Inc. after Home Depot Inc. reportedly made its own bid.

title: Citigroup Hires JPMorgan Tech Veteran Rajkovic as M&A Co-Head
content: Citigroup Inc. is hiring veteran JPMorgan Chase & Co. banker Drago Rajkovic as global co-head of mergers and acquisitions, as the US lender continues poaching senior dealmakers from its rivals to bolster its investment banking franchise.

title: Freeport CEO Says Tariffs Threaten US Copper Mining
content: The threat of US levies on copper imports has been a boon for Freeport-McMoRan Inc., with North America’s top producer cashing in on selling the metal at a premium. Still, the firm’s top boss warns that broader tariffs could hurt an industry President Donald Trump is trying to help.

title: Citadel’s Fixed Income Head Edwin Lin Is Taking a Sabbatical
content: Edwin Lin, Citadel’s head of fixed income and macro, is taking a sabbatical from the firm after 14 years.

title: Darden Weighs Sale of Bahama Breeze Restaurant Chain
content: Darden Restaurants Inc. is considering “strategic alternatives” for its Bahama Breeze chain, Chief Executive Officer Rick Cardenas said.

title: Mulberry Seeks Fresh Cash for Turnaround as Losses Set to Widen
content: Mulberry Group Plc warned on profit and said it needs to raise £20 million ($27 million) to fund the British handbag maker’s turnaround plan.

title: UniCredit Taps Adviser for BPM Bid Branch Sales Amid Deal Doubts
content: UniCredit SpA has tapped an investment bank to manage the possible sale of branches it needs to carry out if it buys Banco BPM SpA, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Luxury Counterfeiters Keep Outsmarting the Makers of $10,000 Handbags
content: Marketplaces are wary of listing counterfeits, but do customers really care?

title: Banks Face €5 Billion French Dividend Tax Bill, Senator Says
content: Banks in France are facing a combined tax bill of as much as €5 billion ($5.8 billion) over contentious trades allegedly designed to escape levies on dividend payments, according to a lawmaker who dubbed the process a “fraud.”

title: US Banks That Fueled Ireland’s Finance Rebound Face Tariff Angst
content: When the US launched sweeping tariffs against trade partners in April, BlackRock Inc. Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink found himself in Ireland, one of the countries with most to lose if US multinationals were forced to curtail their operations overseas.

title: Sondakh’s Rajawali Is Said to Put Sale of Indonesian Gold Miner Archi on Hold
content: PT Rajawali Corp., an Indonesian conglomerate owned by tycoon Peter Sondakh, has halted a potential sale of its controlling interest in gold miner PT Archi Indonesia, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Greenland Awards Permit for Metal Critical to Defense Industry
content: Greenland has given permission to a Canadian mining company to explore for molybdenum, a metal critical to the production of steel, amid growing demand from the defense industry.

title: China’s Warning on Blind-Box Toys Sends Pop Mart Shares Sliding
content: Pop Mart International Group Ltd. shares dropped in Hong Kong after a Chinese state media commentary called for stricter regulation of blind-box toys and trading cards, stoking concern over the company’s wildly popular Labubu dolls business.

title: China’s Rare Earth Magnet Exports Slump in May, Especially to US
content: Chinese exports of rare earth magnets slumped further in May, with shipments to the US showing an especially steep drop due to the trade war with Washington.

title: Lower Gas Prices to Spur Record July Fourth Road Trips, AAA Says
content: A record number of US drivers are expected to hit the road for the July Fourth holiday period starting next weekend, helped by the cheapest gasoline in four years.

title: Insider Trading Siblings Used Lockdown to Make £1 Million
content: Before the market opened on Feb. 4, 2020, traders were watching Swiss testing company SGS SA, waiting for its shares to drop.

title: Foreign Automakers’ Share in China Is Only Set to Dwindle
content: The picture for foreign automakers in China doesn’t get any rosier with new research from consultant AlixPartners showing local brands’ dominance will climb to as high as 76% by 2030 as the market share of Japanese, European and US companies dwindles.

title: Temu US Sales Plunge 25% as Amazon Rival Shifts Focus Elsewhere
content: Temu’s sales decline in the US is deepening as the online marketplace drastically cuts spending on advertising targeting American consumers, signaling a shift in focus after President Donald Trump’s tariff barrage.

title: Voyager Technologies Shares Soar In Market Debut
content: Shares of Denver-based space and defense tech startup Voyager Technologies closed up 82% in first-day trading Wednesday, delivering the latest sign that the IPO market is alive and well.

title: Circle Shares Soar 168% In First Day On NYSE, Potentially Unlocking IPO Market

title: Voyager Technologies Sets Price Range For IPO As Spacetech Funding Takes Off

title: Here Are The Fintech Companies That Could Go Public In 2025
content: After several quiet years, it appears that 2025 may be the year that the U.S. market finally sees a flurry of fintech IPOs. Here are some of the companies we’re keeping our eyes on.

title: Fintech Funding Holds Strong As Airwallex Lands $300M
content: Business payments platform Airwallex has announced that it closed on $300 million at a $6.2 billion valuation. The financing includes $150 million in Series F funding and another $150 million for secondary share purchases.

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B
content: Cybersecurity company Proofpoint announced that it plans to acquire Hornetsecurity, a security provider specialized in Microsoft 365 software tools, in a deal reportedly valued at around $1 billion.

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: AI Autonomous Agents Are Top 2025 Trend For Seed Investment
content: Earlier this week, we wrote about investment trends popping up at seed stage. However, we left out one area where funding activity was so voluminous it warranted its own dedicated piece. Unsurprisingly, it is about AI.

title: What Seed Trends Say About The Future: Live Long, Recycle And Launch More Satellites
content: After plowing through a huge pile of seed funding rounds, we identified four areas where seed is trending this year: longevity, defense, waste reduction and spacetech. Here's where a lot of that investment is going.

title: A Deep Dive Into The Leading Investors In Unicorns Minted Since 2023
content: Since 2023, 259 new unicorns have joined The Crunchbase Unicorn Board, adding $605 billion in total value and altogether raising $130 billion, Crunchbase data shows. We take a look at who's leading new investments.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
